intro: Tiaridium prostratum, commonly known as the prostrate tiaridium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with slender stems and small, palmate leaves. It produces clusters of showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known.
